required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcomes for Lumbar Decompressions With Use of Liposomal Bupivicaine
clinical_study.official_title: A Double Blinded Randomized Control Trial in Outcomes for Lumbar Decompressions With Use of Liposomal Bupivicaine

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the benefit of using liposomal bupivicaine in lumbar laminectomies in terms of length of stay, IV narcotic use, 30-day narcotic use, visual analog score (VAS) and 30-day readmissions

detailed_description.textblock: Recent evidence suggests the use of liposomal bupivicaine (LB) in lumbar spine surgery shortens length of hospital stay and overall post-operative narcotic use. Studies have shown its utility in single level microdiscectomies and lumbar fusions, but there have been no publications regarding lumbar laminectomies and associated outcomes with LB. The investigators' hypothesis is that LB will significantly shorten inpatient stays as well as overall narcotic usage in single, double or multi-level lumbar laminectomies.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: The PI, co-Investigators, and clinicians will be blinded to the patient's treatment arm. The pharmacist will be unblinded.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall length of hospital stay from hospital admission to hospital discharge
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospital admission until date of hospital discharge, assessed up to 2 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Length of stay will be measured in hours

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospital admission until date of hospital discharge, assessed up to 2 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: Tracked by patient's electronic medical record
Narcotic usage will be assessed via state narcotic databases.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analog Pain scale scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, Day of Procedure, Prior to Hospital Discharge (Post-op, Up to 2 weeks), Up to 30-days post-surgery (Follow-Up#1) and up to 12-months post-op follow up
secondary_outcome.description: The scale is called the Visual Analog Pain scale. This scale provides a measure of the patient's reported level of pain . Patients will be asked to rate their pain level using the Visual Analog Pain scale. This scale uses numbers, 1-10, with 1 being no pain and 10 being the worst pain. It also uses faces depicting no pain up to the worst pain. Lower reported scores indicate the patient has little to no pain, which is desirable.
Occurrences of readmission will be tracked by patient's electronic medical record

intervention.description: Injection of either liposomal bupivicaine or standard local anesthetic during surgical procedure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or Female
2. Adult (≥18 yo)
3. Lumbar stenosis
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Co-morbidities precluding surgery
2. ≤18 yo
3. Pregnant
4. Breastfeeding
5. Need for instrumented fusion
6. Prisoners
7. Intra-operative CSF leak (identified by gush of CSF)
8. Daily pre-operative opioid use of > 25 morphine Eq/day
9. Previous lumbar surgery at indicated level

patient_data.ipd_description: There is no plan to share IPD.
